F1_technology.name: AI & Technology
key_data: AI VC funding = 50% of all global VC ($192.7B through Oct 2025)
Enterprise AI revenue: $37B in 2025 (3x YoY)
Application spend ($19B) now exceeds infrastructure spend ($18B)
85% of AI startups expected out of business within 3 years
Perez cycle: late Installation, approaching Turning Point
F1_technology.2031_projection: Early Deployment phase ‚Äî AI shifts from infrastructure build to systematic economic integration

F2_demographics.name: Demographics
key_data: Japan: -500K population/yr, 397 robots per 10K workers (world #1)
China: fertility 1.12 (among world's lowest), population halves to 633M by 2100
US: native-born working-age population shrinking, immigration = 100% of growth
EU: losing ~1M workers/yr, 22 of 27 countries declining
India: median age 29.8, adding 183M working-age people by 2050
Africa: 830M youth aged 15-35 by 2050
F2_demographics.2031_projection: World splits into shrinking (Japan/China/EU), peak dividend (India/SEA), and pre-dividend (Africa) labor regimes

F3_geopolitics.name: Geopolitics
key_data: US chip export controls: 4th major revision, 120+ Chinese entities restricted
China: 35% semiconductor equipment self-sufficiency, 15% global AI model share
EU AI Act: high-risk obligations effective Aug 2026, penalties up to 7% global turnover
Global defense spending tops $2.6T; US DoD $13.4B for AI/autonomy
NATO target raised to 5% GDP by 2035
Gulf SWFs: $66B deployed in AI/digital
F3_geopolitics.2031_projection: Three distinct AI regulatory/technology blocs ‚Äî US-led, China-led, EU-regulated ‚Äî with India and MENA as swing players

F4_capital.name: Capital Flows
F4_capital.key_metric: $500B+ AI spend vs 56% seeing no benefit
key_data: 68% of CEOs increasing AI spend despite 56% reporting zero financial benefit
Only 12% of companies achieved both cost and revenue gains from AI
PE refinancing wall: $1.2T debt maturing 2027-2029
Physical production ETFs: Industrials +15.1%, Materials +20.1%
Kearney Reshoring Index fell 311 points ‚Äî intention vs execution gap
95% of manufacturers plan new automation within 3 years
F4_capital.2031_projection: Capital rotation from pure-digital to hard-tech/physical accelerates through Perez Turning Point correction

F5_psychology.name: Psychology & Fear
key_data: 50% of Americans more concerned than excited about AI (up from 37% in 2021)
US AI trust: 32% (lowest major economy) vs China: 87%
Employee job-loss fear: 28% ‚Üí 40% in 2 years
Only 2% of executives made layoffs from actual AI implementation ‚Äî rest anticipatory
86% of consumers say human interaction important in brand experience
96% of music professionals open to paying more for human-created content
F5_psychology.2031_projection: Fear normalizes but creates permanent parallel economy ‚Äî human premium, verification, trust-bridging services

F6_energy.name: Energy & Resources
F6_energy.key_metric: AI data centers: 4.4% US electricity by 2030
key_data: US data center electricity: 4.4% of total by 2030 (up from ~2%)
Hyperscaler power deals: Microsoft (Three Mile Island restart), Amazon (nuclear), Google (Kairos SMR)
Solar LCOE: $24-96/MWh (cheapest new electricity in history)
Global battery storage: 120 GWh installed (2025), doubling annually
China controls 60-90% of rare earth processing
Copper structural deficit: $9,500/ton, new mines take 15-20 years
F6_energy.2031_projection: Energy becomes THE gatekeeper of AI deployment ‚Äî winners defined by power access, nuclear restarts, and mineral supply chains

us.name: United States
us.2031_outlook: Fastest AI adoption in services, reshoring dependent on automation, financial services cascade creates mass restructuring

china.name: China
china.2031_outlook: Automation adoption among world's highest from demographic necessity, parallel tech stack matures, worker-to-retiree ratio hits 4:1

eu.name: European Union
eu.2031_outlook: Slower AI adoption vs US/China but deeper regulatory framework exports globally, defense-tech surge

japan.name: Japan
japan.2031_outlook: Template for every aging economy ‚Äî solutions that work in Japan export to US/EU within 5-15 years

india.name: India
top_forces: 70% youth skills gap = massive reskilling opportunity
india.2031_outlook: World's largest supplier of new workers, AI augmentation (not replacement) model, education-tech epicenter

latam.name: Latin America
latam.2031_outlook: Nearshoring-driven manufacturing growth, Brazil as regional AI leader, Argentina reform experiment

mena.name: Middle East & North Africa
top_forces: SWFs becoming top-5 global AI capital allocators
Economic diversification from oil driving AI investment
mena.2031_outlook: Third global AI capital center alongside US and China, massive infrastructure buildout, alternative funding source for physical production

africa.name: Africa
top_forces: Only continent with explosive working-age growth
africa.2031_outlook: Largest untapped market for AI-native services, mobile-first model, constrained by connectivity and digital skills

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Patient trust, opacity, liability, clinical vs admin split
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Admin/back-office AI normalized, clinical AI still contested

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Billable-hour conflict, 700+ AI hallucination court cases, liability
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: AI-augmented practice standard, human judgment premium remains

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Academic integrity, cultural values, faculty resistance
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: AI tools ubiquitous, human teaching premium emerges
95% plan automation by 2028, robotics standard in new facilities

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Business model conflict, expertise identity, client trust
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Barbell: routine cognitive eliminated, judgment premium rises

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Identity/authenticity crisis, union action, human premium demand
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Parallel artisan economy, verification infrastructure, premium human content

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: 80% automation risk in call centers, but 86% want human interaction
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Automated base layer, human premium tier, loyalty-driven differentiation

key_findings.title: Fear Is a Market, Not Just Sentiment
key_findings.detail: Fear-driven markets (safety, compliance, governance, ethics, insurance, verification) total ~$40B today growing at 20-45% CAGR. AI Ethics Consulting alone at 45.9% CAGR. By 2031 these could exceed $300-500B. Fear of AI is itself a massive economic force creating entirely new industry categories.

key_findings.title: The Great Anticipatory Overshoot
key_findings.detail: Only 2% of executives report making large layoffs from actual AI implementation. The vast majority are anticipatory ‚Äî based on AI's potential, not performance. This creates psychological overshoot: more fear, displacement, and safety demand than actual technology warranted. Correction likely by 2028-2029.

key_findings.title: Three Demographic Regimes Diverge
key_findings.detail: Shrinking labor force (Japan -500K/yr, China fertility 1.12, EU -1M/yr, US native-born declining) creates automation pull. Peak dividend (India median age 29.8, adding 183M workers) creates skills opportunity. Pre-dividend (Africa 830M youth by 2050) creates future market. Same technology, completely different adoption paths.

key_findings.title: Perez Turning Point Approaching
key_findings.detail: AI startup failure: 85% expected out within 3 years. Application spend now exceeds infrastructure spend. $500B/yr invested but 56% of CEOs see no benefit. These are classic late-Installation Frenzy signals. Correction before Deployment phase when structural forces create maximum leverage.

key_findings.title: Human Premium Is Durable
key_findings.detail: 96% of music professionals open to paying more for human-created. 86% of consumers want human interaction. Up to 16% willingness to pay more for human service. Blockchain verification targeting mainstream by mid-2026. Not replacing AI ‚Äî creating parallel artisan economy like organic food movement.

key_findings.title: Energy Is the Gatekeeper
key_findings.detail: AI compute demand outpacing energy supply. Hyperscalers restarting nuclear (Three Mile Island), building SMRs, signing dedicated renewable PPAs. Winners defined by power access. Creates new Ricardian rent around power-advantaged locations. Water stress emerging as secondary constraint.

key_findings.title: Three AI Blocs Are Forming
key_findings.detail: US-led (innovation-first, state-level patchwork), China-led (state-controlled, content-aligned), EU-regulated (comprehensive risk-based, extraterritorial). India and MENA are swing players. Cross-bloc compliance becomes its own business category. Each bloc develops distinct tech stacks.

key_findings.title: Reskilling Chasm Is the Central Policy Challenge
key_findings.detail: 170M new jobs created but 92M displaced by 2030 (WEF). 39% of current skills will be obsolete. 59% of workers won't receive adequate training. Entry-level workers aged 22-25 already seeing 13% employment decline in AI-exposed occupations. Alternative credentials surging: certificates +28%.

v2_landscape_preserved.note: v2 business models preserved as evidence base for sector transformation projections
confirmed_cascades: Financial services: BLS -49K, financials ETF last (+0.5%), delinquency 1.78%

cycle_history.note: PIVOT: Economy mapping. 6 forces, 8 regions, fear friction, demographics, geopolitics.
